abstract.p: Hotwire.com, online ticket selling service to be introduced in fall by six major airlines, names Goodby, Silverstein & Partners to handle its advertising account; billings estimated at $40 million (S)

block.p: Hotwire.com, an online ticket selling service to be introduced in the fall by six major airlines, said yesterday that it had named Goodby, Silverstein & Partners in San Francisco to handle its account. Billings were estimated at $40 million.

John Hommeyer, chief marketing officer at Hotwire in San Francisco, confirmed reports of the decision this week in Advertising Age and Adweek. The decision came, he said, after a monthlong review that had been narrowed to Goodby, Silverstein, part of the Omnicom Group, and two other finalists in San Francisco, Leagas Delaney and Black Rocket.
